descr.p: html2textrender.pas contains an HTML-to-Text renderer. It converts HTML into plain text by converting tags and their attributes to a representation as plain text.

THTML2TextRenderer is an HTML-to-Text renderer. It converts HTML into plain text by stripping tags and their attributes. Converted text includes configurable indentation for HTML tags that affect the indentation level. The following HTML tags include special processing in the renderer:
The following Named character entities are converted to their plain text equivalent:
Other named character entities or numeric character entities are included verbatim in the plain text output.
A UTF-8 Byte Order Mark in the HTML is ignored.

Set values for properties in the class instance to customize the content and formatting produced in the output. Use the Render method to parse and process the HTML content passed to the constructor, and generate the output for the class instance.

element.name: THTML2TextRenderer.AddOutput
element.short: Appends text to the plaint-text output for the renderer

descr.p: AddOutput is a Boolean function used to append the value specified in aText to the output for the renderer.

AddOutput ensures that a space character is included for wrapped lines in the HTML when there are no pending new lines . Otherwise, the required number of line ending sequences are appended to the output for the render and the line count is increased accordingly. If the line count exceeds the maximum number allowed in Render, the value in MoreMark is appended to the output.
Pending new line(s) also cause required indentation spaces to be appended to the output.
The value in aText is appended to the output for the renderer prior to exiting from the method.
AddOutput is used in the implementation of the Render, HtmlTag, and HtmlEntity methods.

element.name: THTML2TextRenderer.AddOutput.aText
element.short: Text value appended to the output for the renderer

element.name: THTML2TextRenderer.AddOutput.Result
element.short: True when the value was added to the output; False when the maximum number of lines is exceeded

element.name: THTML2TextRenderer.HtmlTag
element.short: Handles an HTML tag and its attributes values

descr.p: HtmlTag is a Boolean function used to locate and process an HTML start or end tag, and any attribute name/value pairs present in the tag. HtmlTag handles the following HTML tag and attribute/value names:

dl.dd: Sets the FInHeader flag to indicate that the content is for a whole page.
Call Reset to initialize the renderer.
Adds a new line sequence to the output.
Sets the fInDivTitle flag, and adds a NewLine and a TitleMark to the output. When the CLASS attribute is omitted or has a different value, only a NewLine sequence is appended.
Appends a trailing TitleMark, resets the FInDivTitle flag, and appends a NewLine sequence and decrements the indentation level.
Increments the indentation level and adds a single NewLine prior to adding the content in the list.
Appends a Space character and the LinkBegin sequence to the output.
Appends a LinkEnd sequence and a Space character to the output.
Adds a single NewLine and the content in HorzLine to the output.

descr.p: All other tag names are ignored in the method.
The return value contains True when the HTML content is successfully added by calling AddOutput. The return value is False when the maximum number of lines specified in the Render method is exceeded.

notes.note: Does not appear to recognize HTML5 empty attributes (with no attribute value assignment).

element.name: THTML2TextRenderer.HtmlTag.Result
element.short: True when output is successfully added to the output; False when the maximum number of lines is exceeded

element.name: THTML2TextRenderer.HtmlEntity
element.short: Handles an HTML character entity

descr.p: HtmlEntity is a Boolean function used to convert common character entities in HTML to their plain text equivalent. The following Named character entities are converted to their plain text equivalent:
Other named character entities or numeric character entities are included verbatim in the plain text output.
The return value is the result from the AddOutput method, and contains False when the maximum number of lines has been exceeded in the renderer.

element.name: THTML2TextRenderer.HtmlEntity.Result
element.short: True on success, False when the maximum number of lines is exceeded

element.name: THTML2TextRenderer.Reset
element.short: Resets the state and output for the renderer

descr.p: Reset is a procedure used to reset the state and output for the renderer. Reset sets values for internal flags used in the class, and clears any content stored in the render output.

element.name: THTML2TextRenderer.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance

descr.p: Create is the overloaded constructor for the class instance. An argument passed to the method contains the HTML content examined in the class as either a String value or a TStream instance. The Stream-based variant reads the content in Stream into a String variable for processing. The position in the stream is not changed prior to or after reading its content.

Create stores the HTML content in aHTML to an internal member used when parsing and processing using methods in the class. A UTF-8 Byte Order Mark (BOM) at the start of the HTML content is removed prior to processing.
Create sets the default values for the following properties:

dl.dd: Set to the value in the LineEnding constant for the platform or OS.
Set to the UTF-8 character '◈' (#9672 or #x25C8)
Set to the characters '...' (Three Period characters - not an Ellipsis character).

element.name: THTML2TextRenderer.Create.aHTML
element.short: String with the HTML content examined in the class

element.name: THTML2TextRenderer.Create.Stream
element.short: TStream instance with the HTML content examined in the class

element.name: THTML2TextRenderer.Destroy
element.short: Frees the class instance

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. Destroy calls the inherited destructor.

element.name: THTML2TextRenderer.Render
element.short: Parses the HTML and renders the plain text output

descr.p: Render is a String function used to parse the HTML passed as an argument to the constructor, and to render the plain text output in the return value. The output is limited to the number of lines specified in the aMaxLines argument. The default value for the argument is the MaxInt constant.
descr.remark: Please note: AddOutput, HtmlTag, and HtmlEntity return False if aMaxLines was exceeded.
descr.p: Renders calls the Reset method to set the initial values for members and flags used in the class instance. The parsing mechanism looks for HTML tags and character entities/references, processes their content, and calls the AddOutput method. Whitespace (characters #32, #9, #10, and #13) between tags and entities is always normalized into a single space character.
Render calls the HtmlTag, HtmlEntity, and AddOutput methods to process the HTML content passed to the method.

element.name: THTML2TextRenderer.Render.aMaxLines
element.short: Maximum number of lines to process in the method

element.name: THTML2TextRenderer.Render.Result
element.short: String with the plain text content extracted from the HTML

element.name: THTML2TextRenderer.LineEndMark
element.short: Defines the end-of-line character sequence

descr.p: LineEndMark is a String property which contains the end-of-line character sequence inserted in the plain text output for the renderer. By convention, the default value for the property is the value from the LineEnding constant defined for the platform or OS. The value is inserted in the renderer output in the AddOutput method.

element.name: THTML2TextRenderer.TitleMark
element.short: Defines the character used to delimit a title or header

descr.p: TitleMark is inserted both prior to and following a title/header found in the HTML content in the HtmlTag method. The default value is the UTF-8 character '◈' (Decimal #9672 or Hex #x25C8).

element.name: THTML2TextRenderer.HorzLineMark
element.short: Represents a HR tag in the plaint text output

descr.p: HorzLineMark is used in the implementation of the HtmlTag method when a HR tag is encountered in the HTML content. The default value for the property is the UTF-8 characters '——————————————————' (Eighteen Hex #$2013 characters).

element.name: THTML2TextRenderer.LinkBeginMark
element.short: Represents an A start tag in the plain text output

descr.p: LinkBeginMark is a String property used to represent the start of the plain text output for an HTML A tag. LinkEndMark is used to represent the end of the anchor. The value is added to the plain text output for the renderer in the HtmlTag method.

element.name: THTML2TextRenderer.LinkEndMark
element.short: Represents an A end tag in the plain text output

descr.p: LinkEndMark is a String property used to represent the end of the plain text output for an HTML A tag. LinkBeginMark is used to represent the start of the anchor. The value is added to the plain text output for the renderer in the HtmlTag method.

element.name: THTML2TextRenderer.ListItemMark
element.short: Represents a list item in the plain text output

descr.p: ListItemMark is a String property which contains the character(s) inserted before a HTML LI tag. The value is added to the plain text output for the renderer in the HtmlTag method.

element.name: THTML2TextRenderer.MoreMark
element.short: Indicates that the plain text output is truncated due to a line limit restriction

descr.p: The default value for the property is three (3) Period ('.') characters - NOT an Ellipsis character. The value is added to the plain text output for the renderer when the maximum number of lines has been exceeded in the AddOutput method.

element.name: THTML2TextRenderer.IndentStep
element.short: Number of space characters used for each indentation level in the plain text output

descr.p: IndentStep is an Integer property used to indicate the number of space characters generated for each indentation level in the plain text output for the renderer. The default value for the property is 2, and is used in the implementation of the AddOutput method.
